#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=How does The Modern Whig Party differ from America 's major political parties ( Republican , Democratic , Constitution , Green , Libertarian )
#Text=The Modern Whig Party differs from the other political parties because our members come from across the political spectrum .
#Text=Our common sense approach has found a way to reconcile actual common ground among individuals from all political stripes .
#Text=The Modern Whig Party strives to remain mainstream and practical .
#Text=Unlike other parties , we do n't expect our members to agree with everything , and in fact encourage them to remain independent minded .
#Text=In a way , the Modern Whig Party is different in that it is designed to provide a palatable home to independents and those who want to be independent .
#Text=Another element to look at is the diversity of our members .

#Text=Our state leaders include retired Vietnam veterans , Iraq/Afghanistan veterans , attorneys , college students , a retired CEO , a prominent rock musician , a golf professional , teachers and many others .
#Text=What we have found is that even though someone is socially liberal , they also may be very conservative when it comes to other issues .
#Text=Same for our conservative members .
#Text=This goes back to our theory that most people find themselves cherry-picking between issues of both major parties , but ultimately end up on one side of the fence .
#Text=In the end , we offer a realistic and mainstream home for those who want to pick and choose from various ideals and solutions from across the political spectrum .
#Text=Currently , are there any elected officials in the United States that are members of The Modern Whig Party ?
#Text=By design , we have held off on running or endorsing candidates this year .
#Text=The established third parties are essentially marginalized because they consistently trot out candidates just to lose .

#Text=Our goal is to avoid such traps as we attempt to build a mainstream and practical organization that in time will be strong and credible enough to actually be a force in politics and our communities .
#Text=Our plan from the beginning is to operate methodically and gradually .
#Text=The Modern Whig Party leadership is comprised of people who are not deluded into thinking that we are somehow entitled to members .
#Text=We also are not deluded into thinking that the majority of voters are ready to take that plunge and actually vote for a third party , let alone a group called the " Whigs . "
#Text=We understand the reality , and perhaps that is our biggest asset .
#Text=As we grow , our name will slowly filter back into the mainstream mentality .
#Text=Our longterm strategy is nuanced but includes initially running a few candidates who are members of the Modern Whig Party but will initially run on the Democratic and Republican tickets .
#Text=The plan is to run a few candidates on state and local ballots in 2009 and then support three candidates for Congress in 2010 .

#Text=If our members can win a few during this time , while at the same time our membership ranks continue to rise , we will have accomplished a winning track record from which to really make our move .
#Text=We believe that we need to be innovative in order to succeed as we know the odds are stacked against us .
#Text=But nothing ever came out of doing nothing .
